website_summaries.verdict: Great quality at a highly competitive price. An outstanding value for the money.
pros: Users praise its clean sound through the built-in speaker, though a headphone jack is also available
Good reception, even in remote areas
cons: The speaker can "buzz" when volume is turned up

customer_reviews.title: Great Small AM-FM Radio!
customer_reviews.text: Very small. Very lightweight. Uses 2 AAA cells. Easy to operate controls. Sound through Panasonic RP HJE120-K earphones [20-20khz] is extremely good! Great frequency response. Sound reproduction is superb! I like to DX at night. I try to receive distant stations and low power stations. This radio is not good for that. Reception is pretty much limited to your local stations. AM section does a great job serving up local programming. FM section with the tiny antenna extended does a good job separating local FM stations. For it tiny size and weight this is a good radio to put in your bag. It’s one more bit of information. Five Stars with a few reservations.
customer_reviews.author: IMHOTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little radio
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is awesome! It's probably not the best out there but it works pretty well and fits in your pants pocket without taking up much room. The battery life on this thing is amazing too (which is what bumped it up to 5 stars for me). I use it maybe 6 hours a week, have had it for 3 years, and have changed the batteries only twice! I would def. buy this again if something happened to mine.
customer_reviews.author: cris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This little radio exceeds all expectations. I live in Wyoming where there are few stations and this radio picks them all up nicely. The sound is very nice and clear especially for talk radio, speaker sounds better than my $200 cell phone's speaker. Better radio overall than my large sony icf-38 and the batteries last forever. This radio is a steal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Trebek

customer_reviews.title: Kaito KA200 Pocket AM/FM Radio
customer_reviews.text: The Kaito KA200 Pocket AM/FM Radio is ok but not great. The tuner is not very sensitive, but it does pick up the stations with stronger signals. The sound quality is not very good, but voices are clear enough to understand. The volume is not very loud but loud enough for a quiet room. I bought this to use as a small travel radio, and it fills that bill. So far it has been reliable, and that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly balky controls--but it passed the tests.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 86 yr old father to use on his daily walks. He's pretty fussy and not good with figuring things out, so when I found that the radio takes THREE steps to use it properly, I was a little worried. The ON button is NOT connected to the volume which is separate --- so one turns it on by clicking over the FM or AM. The volume is set with a different switch. Tuning is separate as well--but that's to be expected. Anyway, he hasn't complained --neither about the process involved OR not being able to tune in stations he wants to hear. For that, I'm glad.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little radio! It's smaller than most cell phones, tunes well, good tone. It's what you'd expect of a modern transistor radio, in spite of the reality that few are available these days.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Grabow Jr

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this radio to lock onto a signal even though green light was on for a signal lock. The reception was great while the unit was in the hand, but then once you placed the unit in your pocket or onto something the signal would drift and the station would be just static. If you needed something that was just in the hand, it would work but really this unit is just junk.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Sowa

customer_reviews.title: When I turned it on and really started using it I couldn't believe how much awesome was packed into such a tiny frame
customer_reviews.text: When I took this little radio out of the box I couldn't believe my eyes! It was the tiniest thing I'd ever seen! I immediately started regretting my purchase. BUT! When I turned it on and really started using it I couldn't believe how much awesome was packed into such a tiny frame! The sound, the channels etc. everything is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tonkaaatruck

customer_reviews.title: My search is over!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pocket sized radio! AM Radio is going through a golden period thanks to all the political talk. Plus, I must check on the Dodgers sports broadcasts. I can’t function w/o a good radio. I own a number of radios that boast “pocket size” but this is truly it. The sound coming out of this little thing is amazing. Sound is crisp and loud. Volume button is strategically placed to lower when on a string of loud commercials. The two dials are very firm and sturdy and don’t change with a mere touch. Very well thought out design!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael M. (Los Angeles)

customer_reviews.title: static on AM
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these the first one is a 5 rating. the last two which I had to send back have a lot of static on AM which I listen to for my sports. Plus it literally takes 5 min. for the radio to tune into an AM station while all you hear is static. I don't know what they did differently but the first one works great. It is not my area that is causing this static since it happened in 2 different states 150 miles apart. Something is different in the mfg. of this product
customer_reviews.author: tyac77

customer_reviews.title: Swung On and Belted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to listen to Tom Hamilton call Cleveland Indians baseball games when I was out and about. It works great and the signal comes in well on both FM/AM for the most part. I gave it four stars because sometimes in a good signal area, you have to touch the anntenna as a human receiver to get the clearest sound. But for the price, it does what it's supposed to and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Good for AM
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to listen to sports talk radio on AM mostly while riding my bike. When the signal fades in an area the radio signal shuts off instead of going to static white noise before regaining signal. It does pick up AM signal as well as my old Sangean which is 4x the cost of the Kaito. The FM signal picks up well in the limited time I have tried it. Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a "Brand X" radio that's a battery hog - I was going through 2 AAAs per week. The Kaito ran for 3 weeks of daily use before the batteries quit. When the tuning LED quits, it means the batteries are getting low. This radio is about as basic as it gets. The analog tuning dial has nearly zero backlash, and the volume dial goes high enough to use while vacuuming or mowing the grass, since I use headphones exclusively (both channels work - in monaural only). The tinny speaker serves as a backup. Reception is about par.
customer_reviews.author: gerty

customer_reviews.title: Great for price and portability but unsatisfactory for sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This little radio is so cute, even adorable, that I wanted to like it, to be able to write a 5-star review, but I can't. It's conveniently sized, all right, but it's just not a good radio. It doesn't have good sound, It doesn't separate stations well enough, and It has too much extraneous sound, too much static. It's outstanding in terms of size and price, but not for sound. I might buy one for a small child but that's about all. I should also mention that the controls (volume, station, AM/FM, ON/OFF) are very poorly designed and placed; in fact, the worst that I have ever seen on a portable radio.
customer_reviews.author: Niku ..

customer_reviews.title: Fun little radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Dirty Santa gifts. I can't believe how the eventual recipients enjoyed this little radio. It picks up stations well, stays on the station. Has a pull-out antenna to increase the range. Plays as loud, as you would want and has fairly good tone.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Samm

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot express how tiny and cute this radio is! I love it! I have the gray one, and it looks great. Reception on both bands is adequate, definitely. It won't pick up stations from far away places, but I think it would be satisfactory for most people's needs. It easily fits in a front or back pocket, backpack, even a small purse. I think it's even smaller than a pack of cigarettes. Sound is decent for what it is. I have zero complaints, and for such a low price, $12.99, it's a good deal! I intend on keeping it in the backpack I carry every day. You just never know when you might need a tiny radio!
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.Top Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Last only 4 months - Lemon
customer_reviews.text: This radio is a lemon, it lasted less than 5 months before it would tune in stations and emitted a high pitched whine even after numerous battery replacements. I was only trying to use for AM radio for baseball games, and it was useless for even that small task. I would not recommend at all, the chances of getting a lemon are too high.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little radio. I originally bought it as part of a hurricane supplies check-list. I used it some during Irma but now use it at work to listen to the radio at my desk, I take it fishing with me and use it when I’m working on something outside. My family listens to it when we play cards outside it’s good for background music when you still want to have conversation. I have listened to it almost everyday for the past 2 months (I actually didn’t think I would use it this much) and it still works fine and haven’t had to change the batteries yet.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The product is very small and handy but very good on volume
customer_reviews.text: The product is very small and handy but very good on volume. It needs improvement in the following areas 1. Its battery consumption is very quick (in two days) 2. provide an option to run via USB charge 3. tuner channel selection cud be improved 4. Antenna could get an option to move 360 with a pivot at the base - as the reception is bad when it is away from body
customer_reviews.author: Saani

customer_reviews.title: Good price for great sound, sensitivity and small form factor
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound for the size both in quality and loudness. Being partially deaf, this tunes in stations AM and FM loud and clear. The ear plug jack allows for monaural listening but delivers audio to both ear buds or head sets -- not just one side. Has a tuning light generally not seen on radios at this price point. Selectivity of FM is good but not as tight as more expensive radios. The battery also lasts long given that they are AA. I use this small radio both regularly and bought another for backup or emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: For only $12 I am very impressed with the quality of this radio. It feels durable and picks up channels about as good as you could expect with its antenna. I was getting clear channels in my basement. This will come in handy if there's ever a blackout or something catastrophic like a nuclear war with North Korea. I believe we should always prepare for these type of events cause it's a very cheap insurance policy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Must have for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for Hurricane Irma and it was excellent. Small enough to carry every where and the signal was very clear. The volume was also pretty high. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Mayra A.

customer_reviews.title: It's small - but not outstanding in any other way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 20 old Radio Shack pocket radio - was expecting that a 20 year advancement in technology would be an improvement in all areas. I primarily would use this radio for AM. Pros: About the only think good I can say about this radio is that it's small. Cons: It's hard to tune - tuning is way too touchy When tuned, the signal is not as clear as my old Radio Shack pocket radio It does not tune in all of the AM stations that I know it should The volume control is too touchy The sound is way to "tinny"
customer_reviews.author: Bytemon

customer_reviews.title: It works just great! I recommended it!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this from Amazon, it’s unbelievably awesome. It’s really extra tiny, does work fine. Loud, clear not fidelity sound, but really clear. It’s cheap and perfect for my fishing shirt pocket. Free’s my hands while fishing. Bought it for my kayak and it’s really so compact and works just great. I will buy another one to keep in my room. In the Houston area, it did pick up all my FM radio stations clear. It also picks up AM stations clear. I counted 10 (ten) AM stations very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound for it`s size and tunes in good
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than the well known transistor radio size. Fantastic sound for it`s size and tunes in good. Old school quality in a new purchase is a welcome surprise. Worth every penny for the modest price, A nice compact radio. Nice to be able to get a simple device like this like days of old. The plain AM/FM radio of all things is getting hard to find. This would make a great gift for just about anyone. A great gift for you get for yourself as I did.
customer_reviews.author: whofan

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for such a tiny radio.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this tiny radio. The sound level is quite loud and clear, easily adjusted. It picks up both AM and FM radio quite clearly, which I was happy about after reading some of the reviews. We live far out in the woods so I think we are good people to judge this. Controls are easy to adjust and to understand. A great deal! It has a space for earphones. Transistor radios are now hard to find so I am doubly pleased. It runs on 2 triple As.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get too many stations, but enough basic ones. However once you have found one you can't move this radio or it will instantly go staticky. Batteries drained out pretty quickly. Does the job for something really basic to be used once in a while. But you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: LunaNoel

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small garden and deer and rabbits can be a problem. I'm sure I'm not the first to think that the animals might stay away if they think people are close by or if they hear noises so I tune this to a talk station, place it in a baggie, and lay it under/around my tomatoes. Turn on at night, off in the morning. It seems to work, although the lack of damage could be coincidental. In any event this radio serves the purpose for which it was bought.
customer_reviews.author: cokoamojo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for AM radio walking
customer_reviews.text: This radio was just what I have been looking for the past several years. I have tried 2 or 3 diferent radios for my walks. I like to listen to AM talk radio, and most radios cut out all the time when you change direction. This little guy fits into my waterproof neck pouch and does not lose signal no matter which direction I am walking. A great value that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a solution for AM on your stereo amplifier.  Great for its designed use.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice, basic, very small, working AM/FM radio receiver. Very cute. Very portable. Weighs hardly anything, including with the small AAA batteries. I was hoping that I'd be able to plug it into the aux port of my stereo amplifier to get AM. Unfortunately, when plugged in that way, it emits nothing but a buzzing sound. Unplug it and the station comes-in again. Works fine with headphones. Will keep it for travel. Can bring it to the baseball game.
customer_reviews.author: dcl

customer_reviews.title: My new travel companion
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. The radio is really small, solidly built and a good performer. I'm a NPR News listener and this radio performs very well for talk shows and live games reports. Don't expect HI-FI sound out the (small) speaker. It is essentially a "no-frills" portable radio and a trustworthy travel companion. Ideal for listening the morning news while shaving in the next hotel room. The assembly is quite good and the dialings are tight and effective. Battery consumption is average and upon usage. At this price point the KA200 delivers it in spades.
customer_reviews.author: Lubeff

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This radio worked a couple of days, then it was worthless. Anytime the volume was just a little above soft, it cut out and I heard nothing. Don't buy this radio. I highly recommend "Portable AM FM Pocket Radio with Earphones, Digital Battery Operated Walkman Radio with Preset, Timer, Alarm Clock, Lock Station for Jogging, Walking, Traveling by PRUNUS" Sold by: Prunus Store It's cheaper and works great!
customer_reviews.author: OC Suds

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this radio. I purchased the first on in October 2016 when I was looking for a small radio to take outside when I am working in the yard or garden. It has now been dropped, set in dirt and overall very well-used and still work very well. I am only purchasing a new one because my husband keeps taking it when he works outside.
customer_reviews.author: tmtrvlr

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this because my old digital radio had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my old digital radio had a problem with the earphone plug being very touchy. I use it at the gym to watch TV while exercising. They have a local signal posted for each station. It's kind of hard to get it tuned since it's the old fashioned wheel tuner. But it's so cute and works well enough. Small enough to put in my exercise pants pocket. There's no lock to keep station though so it can get out of tune when side wheel is touched.
customer_reviews.author: Drewa

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work well too far out of town.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent little radio. It isn't working too well for me; but I live in a place that is about as rural as a place can be without being called rural. For the price; I think it's safe to say that this radio would be great for someone living in a big city near the radio towers. If you are looking for a radio that works really well everywhere; this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Mercurius

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small pocket radio for pocket change. This is that radio. For the change I paid, I am happy it did not have any bells and whistles (it doesnt even come with an earphone, flimsy cover or crappy demo batteries). Every penny seems to have gone into the core components and it does an excellent job of catching am and fm waves and converting them to audio. Recommended if you are looking for a small, cheap, utilitarian am/fm radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazno

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these radios to include in shoeboxes for Operation Christmas Child. I bought these based on reviews. I was not disappointed. Very tiny radio about the size of a pack of playing cards. It easily picked up radio stations and the speaker quality was clear and loud. I was impressed. I will buy more of these for next year's shoeboxes.
customer_reviews.author: P. MacLearn

customer_reviews.title: Cute, compact, good quality
customer_reviews.text: This radio is cute. It fits in my pocket easily and also fits in my palm, easy to hold too. To my surprise that it pick up signal really well, both FM and AM, especially in my area, where the mini Eton cannot pick up some stations, this one still does fine. I use it to replace my other portable Grundig when travel. With its tiny size and speaker, the sound comes from it really impressive, loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Therese

customer_reviews.title: it really seems to be a good quality little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a small radio, about the size of a bar of soap, but thinner. The controls are a bit different than most transistor radios--- am/fm/off is one slide bar, volume is on top. And being smaller, it has a smaller speaker, with less bass. But having said all that, it really seems to be a good quality little radio. The tuning is very good... it locks into a station and holds it. I've had it for several weeks, and use it every day. Still on the first set of batteries. So, if you want a small radio, this one should do it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little radio it's about the size of a deck of cards it's actually pretty loud for its size and has outstanding AM FM reception I cannot believe how good it brings in radio stations I will be buying a few more of these
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pocket Radio.
customer_reviews.text: This little guy holds my stations, gives a clear signal with decent voice. As an AM listener I should purchase another when this cheapie (price wise) bits the dust. I own several pocket radios and this one is tops. Living in a rural area and using them outside is simply an easy way to go and this one fills my needs quite well. It's my go-to guy and I may have talked myself into buying another!
customer_reviews.author: L. Carl

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievably small, smaller than a pack of cards, about the size of a credit card only fatter. Fits in a jeans pocket with lots of room to spare. The sound from such a small radio is amazing. I bought this as a bedtime radio so I could listen to George Noory and his tales of the UFOs without having a room size radio on and it's perfect for that purpose. It runs on two small AAA batteries and takes headphones, though it doesn't come with them. It also has its own speaker so that headphones aren't necessary. I don't know how they dit it, but it's perfect for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: dizzheart

customer_reviews.title: SometimesSimple is Better
customer_reviews.text: . I needed a small device to listen to on walks. Sometimes I listen to music and other times talk radio and news. The Kaito KA200 is what I needed, especially for AM talk/news radio. I plug in earbuds and the audio on AM is quite good. The same is true for FM. For FM the sound is mono, but audio does come through both right and left (some other radios will have audio through one side). The tiny speaker is OK, but for the size don't expect much. The price was right and it fit what I needed
customer_reviews.author: JBTeach19732009

customer_reviews.title: Perfect radio for what I need
customer_reviews.text: This radio is perfect for what I needed. I wanted an old style transistor radio to listen to sports talk, a game or the news on nights when I can't sleep. The small size is fantastic. I use some earbuds with this and it works perfect. I live in Pennsylvania and get very good reception with the antenna down, and even better reception when I put it up. Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wagger

customer_reviews.title: or use the headphones and keep in your pocket it's perfect, but I wouldn't suggest keeping on speaker and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not very loud, if you're sitting in one place, or use the headphones and keep in your pocket, but I wouldn't suggest keeping on speaker and leaving it one place while you move around the house. Of course it doesn't have the best reception outside of my house. but I think for the price I got a good product. I just think I was expecting too much for ten dollars, and decided to purchase a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Dovegirl

customer_reviews.title: Try something else...
customer_reviews.text: Something's off. So many favorable reviews.... There must be a quality control problem. The unit I received is absolutely not satisfactory: poor selectivity, poor sound. No comparison to my very old Zenith transistor radio (US-made) a bit larger than this model. A return label for this cigarette-pack-sized radio runs $6.15, almost 50% of the purchase price, so watch out.
customer_reviews.author: azulmarino

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio with great reception!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little radio! I bought it to listen to AM talk radio while doing the dishes and it gets great reception. It's a small speaker so don't expect premium sound but for talk radio it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: nickmarksthespot

customer_reviews.title: Very compact am/fm radio with good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a compact radio to toss into my everyday carry for travel pack. Kind of a small get out of Dodge bag. The other radio I had was 3X the size of this radio and I needed the extra room for a few other items. This works and has strong reception with an analog tuner. At this price you cannot go wrong for a small pocket radio.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome LITTLE radio
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME LITTLE power house of a radio! I work in a hospital where the reception on radios is usually horrible, so I used my cell phone to listen, but was getting sick of using my data, so I read the reviews for this radio and decided for the price, I would try it. I'm SO glad I did, the reception is awesome for AM and I couldn't be happier! I was surprised at how small it is, but it doesn't matter,the sound is great! I usually use the headphones though and they work just fine too!
customer_reviews.author: Baileybeatle

customer_reviews.title: If you like smaller radio stations with less wattage
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly loud for a small radio, and tough. Batteries las a long time. Tinny sound from the small speaker, nothing special, but it plays. Very difficult to tune in to stations. 1 degree of turn can change your station. If you want to listen to high wattage stations in your city, the big commercial stations, this will work for you. If you like smaller radio stations with less wattage, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri Wolf

customer_reviews.title: not the best
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio to use with headphones when walking. While it serves the purpose, it has a very poor tuner, causing a major station to fade in and out and if I walk under electric lines, there is a lot of static. For the money,,it's ok. Didn't want to spend 65 to purchase another Sony Walkman, but looks like I should have.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Radio
customer_reviews.text: I have been using thefor years and have gone through about 4 of them (all successfully bought through Amazon.) They are rugged little devils, but they would occasionally drop out of my breast pocket when I'd bend over. The last one fell out while I was working on my boat (on land) and dropped 10 feet to the concrete; the radio still worked, but the tuner indicator was stuck. So I figured I'd try a new radio and decided on the. It is much smaller than I'd expected and has a great sound, very logical controls and being MUCH smaller, should stay in my pocket-tee pocket much better than the Sony. What more could anyone ask?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Small, cheap, works well.
customer_reviews.text: love this little radio. I just wish it had a place to put a lanyard, or a clip or something to use to hang it. I use it for AM talk radio when working on the back 40 and this has fallen out of my shirt pocket countless times. No damage, yet. reception is pretty good for our weak AM station, better than all my other radios. If I lost it, I'd by another. Small, cheap, works well.
customer_reviews.author: brooks w booker III

customer_reviews.title: A true " Pocket " radio.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how much smaller and lighter this is compared to a " normal " size pocket radio like the offerings from the other brands. The real story is not the miniscule size but the big performance... Good FM and Excellent AM reception.
customer_reviews.author: Mountains are Calling

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lil' Radio, Excellent Reception and Speaker-Volume
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reception. Impressive speaker volume and bass for such a tiny lil' radio that fits in one's palm and pocket. I wanted a pocket radio that would clearly pick up AM stations and the Kaito KA200 does just that. I have found the reception clear as a bell, no static, even when traveling from one area of the city to the next. I couldn't be happier with my Kaito KA200 pocket radio!
customer_reviews.author: G J

customer_reviews.title: This is the best radio I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the best radio I ever bought, including the $179.00 ccrane radios. Clear with speaker, very good AM selectivity and sensitivity. I use it to listen to the giants/warriors games when I am not able to be in front of a TV. Going to try taking these to the baseball and basketball games next. Low power consumption because it is so small. Fantastic product. Other reviews accurate. Looks cheap but the sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works well, good sound and pulls in stations great. I like that the tuning is analog, give me dials any day over digital buttons. Bought this for my elderly mom who likes to fall asleep listening to radio. With this small unit she can place it right on her pillow. Only downside is she leaves it on and bats are dead in a couple days, and she has difficulty changing them herself due to small size (AAA).
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Drive-Ins!
customer_reviews.text: My car will not shut off it's headlights if I need the battery to power the radio--hence I can't go to the drive ins. I originally bought this for camping but I realized--connected with a cable to a bluetooth speaker that has an aux input, I'm back watching at the drive ins again!
customer_reviews.author: Cattknipp

customer_reviews.title: Don't drop it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound was fine, but my mom dropped it once and the sound is horrible and sometimes it doesn't even work so I had to throw it in the trash. She also has a Sony that they don't make anymore and she has dropped it many times and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Portable Radio
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a set of light headphones to listen to the news and talk radio. This is my second one. I ordered the first one about 3 years ago and the on/off slide switch broke. Not a big deal because the cost of this little radio is so low.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Very Low Quality Radio
customer_reviews.text: Sound cuts in and out. Have to use my fingernail to turn on and off. Takes a while to tune to a station and then the sound is not clear. Station availability limited.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Great little compact radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. So compact but BIG sound. Quality radio. It won’t challenge larger ones with better reception, but for its size, it is mighty...and the price can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: edward m

customer_reviews.title: great overall unit.
customer_reviews.text: great for it's price but it could be better. I also have a Kaito KA210 which is slightly bigger and gets better reception then this one. Other then reception I think the only thing I think I would love for this unit to have is a laynard strap slot so I can hang it while I work or I don't have a flat surface to sit it down on.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Sage

customer_reviews.title: Great Micro Radio.
customer_reviews.text: The Kaito KA-200 may be tiny, but it's a powerful performer. I was most impressed with its AM reception, sensitivity and speaker tone. Excellent AM sensitivity for such a small tuner. FM selectivity and sensitivity is also decent. Very good speaker volume and headphone performance on both bands.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: More whimsy but still functional
customer_reviews.text: Terrific sz and concept but reception, speaker quality and too many separate controls r my beefs. A strap woulda been nice but if u want a radio 1/2 the sZ of a normal model- grab it. I break 5 a yr as I have a small ranch near Yosemite park so I never get too attached (lol) to these since antennas, cases, etc can't stand up to ranch rigors. Thumbs up but it does have its shortcomings.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis lovr

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Right when I opened the package and saw the box I was surprised at how small the radio actually is. A true "pocket radio". But don't let it's small size fool you this little radio has the same sound quality as other radios that are double it's size. The construction of the radio is sturdy and compact. Everything about it is well made. I bought it primarily for AM and the AM antenna works just a good as other radios that are triple the price. Very pleased with this purchase. I've had many pocket sized radios throughout the years and this one is definitely my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Mccain

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pocket radio for its size.
customer_reviews.text: OK, its not a Boise Radio, but for about 12 bucks its a Fantastic little radio with excellent reception and plenty of volume. Maybe not so great a radio for music, but for talk radio in a small speaker format, you can't beat this little dandy. Highly recommend it. I own three. This radio is better than my Ford Car radio, NOT KIDDING.(No back ground hiss)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sensitivity and sound through both earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: I mostly decided on this one because it can put sound through both earbuds. I am very impressed with the FM reception and the AM reception is good too. The size and weight is perfect. Anything else would seem oversized next to this. I'm happy to see that the tune light works on both AM and FM. It takes a bit longer to find those AM stations, but I can get NY stations 100 miles away. I find that I have to move the radio around while moving the AM dial in order to get the station. Then I have to put the radio down in that position. Overall, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Heads up! It’s the size of a business card.
customer_reviews.text: As such, the sound it produces is very tinny. I purchased this radio to replace a pocket size Sony that I misplaced. The FM reception is remarkably good when the antenna is extended. AM reception was not as good as I had hoped. I won’t return it but eventually I will look for another Sony.
customer_reviews.author: jma15

customer_reviews.title: Still working.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend, and two years later, he's still quite happy with it. It's basically the old transistor radio that many grew up with decades ago, and, imagine that!, it still has a place and function.
customer_reviews.author: not1word

customer_reviews.title: 1 good one, one lemon
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2, one was ok the other was useless in that it couldn't tune into the same station or even hold those stations it had locked into. I guess an issue with their overall quality control. However ts a very cheap radio so may that's to be expected. Just don't rely on these straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mapke005

customer_reviews.title: Helped us through Irma
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in preparation for Hurricane Irma. We were without power for 6 days and this little radio kept us sane. We were able to hear tornado warnings during the storm and we were kept entertained for days after. I never had to replace the batteries - and it is still going strong. This is a must have for any hurricane kit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for finding break in underground fence!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for finding break in my underground dog containment fence. Doesn’t work at all. Can’t pick up the signal. Useless!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Good sports radio.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio specifically to listen to the am radio broadcasts of the local minor league baseball team at the stadium. It works perfect for this purpose. It worked very well seated down but did suffer a slight decrease in reception quality if you wore it while you went into the restrooms. This is a small pocket radio so it does not have advanced features like station presets but it does have a small light that lights up when you lock into a station.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Crandall

customer_reviews.title: ***PACKS A PUNCH !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled this little monster ( size of a credit card 3/4 thick ) works awesome for the size it packs a punch! Performance is indeed excellent ! I live in a complex I am surrounded by 2 other buildings now you would think reception would not be good well this little monster works well even with the antenna down the reception is excellent ! The sound this put out is truly amazing not stereo but for a small speaker it is pretty amazing and (loud as well) I really enjoy this little radio as I think you will too for 10.99 well worth every penny You will not be disappointed.... I am ordering 2 more !!
customer_reviews.author: Straoline s

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS MY 5 TH ONE.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT RADIO. THIS IS MY 5TH ONE.. 3 BLACK 2 GRAY. I HAVE TWO FOR MYSELF.THEY WORK SO GOOD I PICK UP 3 OTHERS FOR FAMILY MEMBERS THAT SAW IT AND THEN WANTED ONE.ITS VERY VERY SMALL FITS IN ANY POCKET. AND IT LOUD AND CLEAR FROM MY POCKET.I USE IT EVERY MORNING WHILE WALKING. BATTERIES LAST ABOUT 60 TO 80 HOURS PER SET (DURACELL) .THIS RADIO IS SIMPLE 1 SLIDE BUTTON AND 2 KNOBS .AND THATS IT .SIMPLE!!! THE WAY THINGS USE TO BE..
customer_reviews.author: NY

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Radio
customer_reviews.text: A nice little radio. Easily fits in shirt pocket. My only complaint is that the front end isn't very sensitive (does not receive stations very far away). If you are in an urban area, this may not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to pack in my bikepacking rig. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pack in my bikepacking rig. Phone batteries and service are unreliable in the sticks. You can never beat a little AM/FM for chilling in the hammock to catch a Lightning game or listen to 89.7 WUSF.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kowaleski

customer_reviews.title: A Mighty-Mite, and a dirt cheap super sensitive radio for DX-ers and night people.
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing little radio, I can see why folks love them! After a few days of living with this little gadget, it continues to amaze, DX-ing is a pleasure, cheap doesn't equal poor performance. Battery life is exceptional, and its tuner outperforms my Tivoli Model One on fringe stations near Charlotte's "Master Blaster" the 50,000 watt WBT AM.
customer_reviews.author: SNB

customer_reviews.title: The poor thing is trying its best
customer_reviews.text: The poor thing is trying its best. For what you pay for it is ok. I was planning of using it when camping to have something to keep me company but the little guy can just do so much. Even in the city I wasn't able to lock down m favorite radio station. 3 stars because one night in the desert it was able to tune to NPR otherwise my rating would be lower. Barbie and Ken would be happy with it
customer_reviews.author: ARDUINO S.

customer_reviews.title: Great audio for what it is (internal speaker)
customer_reviews.text: This little radio surprised me. Great audio for what it is (internal speaker); sounds amazing on headphones/earbuds, very good battery life, and reception is as good as my stereo on both AM and FM. It's small size was also a surprise; this thing is no bigger than a credit card. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great small pocket radio!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, small pocket AM-FM radio. Its small speaker puts out nice sound, with little distortion if you keep the volume down. It runs on two AAA cells, and easily fits in a pocket or purse. It's about half the size of most "pocket" radios. Great for listening to baseball games! My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio!
customer_reviews.text: Very good radio, small size (credit card size, deck of cards width), solid feel, pretty good reception for size, simple, sound is again good and loud for size. Still have difficulty tuning to exact station when multiple stations very close by on scale but I have this difficulty with any portable radio. This is my second radio purchased, so small, I want to keep one in my car for emergency.
customer_reviews.author: c yo

customer_reviews.title: Got what I hoped for...great AM, and easily portable.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good AM radio. Thougth I would have to pay more than I did. In fact, I actually bought two different brands based on the reviews...both were cheap enough to make the decision a no brainer, and buying both meant I got free shipping...so basically I got the second radio for cheap. AM is very good and I can listen to talk radio while I mow or jog. The size is right, and there is an antenna to improve FM when necessary. Will order this one again should it break. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: TxAny

customer_reviews.title: too small and i meant to order weather you can ...
customer_reviews.text: too small and i meant to order weather you can charge with solar panel, ac power cord or batteries, i dont want to send it back and pay over 6 dollars so ill probably give it to my 7 year old neice if it works, forgot to get batteries, may still send it back saturday after i check it out, so small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute little radio, big performer
customer_reviews.text: Just received this cute little radio about two hours ago. It gets all my local stations on AM and FM and the audio is excellent, the volume can be ramped up to room-filling sound with no distortion. I'm assuming battery life will be good. Incredible value and performance for $12.99.
customer_reviews.author: Ubik

customer_reviews.title: Good little radio
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised of the quality on this radio. Got this for my grandson who was intriged by my radio. He’s been using it awhile and seems like its going to last. Good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Honeybear

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long.
customer_reviews.text: Quite good am reception for a tiny radio. However after 6 months, tuning is very unstable and difficult to hold a station. Battery life is great, but annoying when you need to keep adjusting the tuning dial to hold a station.
customer_reviews.author: RMP

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a clip of some sort.
customer_reviews.text: It's tiny, it works, no frills doesn't come with batteries but I imagine that's how they keep the cost so low. Only thing is I wish it had a belt clip, or loop for a lanyard or some way to carry it hands free. In the pocket works, but i would be willing to pay an extra dollar for some sort of clip or something.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dantzler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio, amazing sound, and very pocketable, plus its easy to tune in a station even without the antenna extended!
customer_reviews.author: bev sotelo

customer_reviews.title: Nice pocket radio.
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to receive the package but under the circuntances that Puerto Rico was devastated from Hurricane María the postal services was having trouble delivering the packages. This Item was for my brother and he says it is a nice item. Small radio perfect to carry anywhere. He says: "At least we can listen to music and hear the news because the entire island have no electricity". Thank you for giving us the opportunity to buy this item and shipped to Puerto Rico.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Dzdz

customer_reviews.title: A Good Quality Little Radio
customer_reviews.text: I owned two portable radios before, one from Radio Shack and the other Brookstone. Both were smaller and digital and could set memory, but neither had good reception. What I like this little Kaito is its simple non-nonsense design and its well made. In other word, it does not look cheaply made. The reception is much better. The little speaker actually comes as a bonus as I could listen to ball game while fishing with my buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Y

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT MIGHTY
customer_reviews.text: Very small radio but good sound. Great for a womens purse. "Or a shoulder bag. Use 2 each Everready AAA batties.
customer_reviews.author: gary green

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff (this is the best)
customer_reviews.text: Being a person of few words, I am simply going to write the review and copy it down 4 times. I liked all of these products and am very happy with all of them. What else can I say. The radio is the best though, but all the rest are good also.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: I. Am well pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with all the other reviews....this radio doesn't need trolls writing fake reviews on how good it is. It really picks up.both AM and FM in rural areas...the signal strength lite is great on both bands. It is my backpacking radio...so,AAA batteries are the same as my LED head lamp....I can pull batteries out of the radio if my headlamp goes dark in an emergency. Worth EVERY Penny of the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: in my bug out bag
customer_reviews.text: cool mini radio for camping and bug out bag. i realized when i was camping that radios are annoying. good for news and weather if you can catch it tho.
customer_reviews.author: Makaua

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is just a basic radio. Manual tuning, no electronic display, no useless fancy functions. On/Off switch and tuning knob are very firm so you wont accidentally turn it on or change stations when putting it in your pocket. Has a small signal strength LED which is handy because the tuning indicator is small. Picks up stations just as well as my vehicle or full size radio in the house. I use it for AM news/talk/sports channels and the volume is more than adequate, and sound quality is fine. It is VERY directional on the AM band...you must rotate it for the best signal...but that is true for any AM radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kaito KA200 Pocket AM/FM Radio, Black
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my small bathroom, as well as, power outages. The radio is both AM/FM, which I really wanted. The radio is small, but works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Mom

customer_reviews.title: He was like I can’t find them anymore
customer_reviews.text: My older buddy was talking about the days you have a little radio in your pocket. He was like I can’t find them anymore. I got this for him and every time I see him he has it on the table playing his music
customer_reviews.author: Joe Navarro

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was a pretty good radio for AM
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a pretty good radio for AM, but have since changed my mind. It doesn't pick up the many local AM stations in San Diego where I live. I usually could receive Los Angeles KNX1070 News Radio with it's powerful wattage, but this little thing barely brings it in. I've since ordered the older discontinued Sony ICF-S10MK2 which reviewers says is good at picking up AM. They seem to have made manual pocket radios with better reception back about 12 years ago. The Sony's must be good. They sold originally for $9.99 but there're priced at $30+ now.
customer_reviews.author: J.Chris

product_meta.title: Kaito KA200 Pocket AM/FM Radio, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackIf you want a real high quality AM/FM radio that you can pick up station in a remote area, this KA200 is a right to use. the super slim size with super Hi-quality circuitry built in, this radio makes you believe that Kaito is a serious manufacturer of the radios, you can compare this radio with any similar radio on the market, this KA200 is simply better than any of them. It is good for sports and travelers.
feature_bullets: Frequency coverage: AM: 530 - 1600 KHz, FM: 87 - 108 MHz
Built-in monophonic earphone jack (earphone not included)
Antenna System : AM: Built-in Ferrite Bar Antenna; FM: Telescopic Antenna

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,271 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
